title: Post-Discharge COPD Care
dialog: Morning Florence, my breathing's a little tight.
I'm on it. Your discharge notes show COPD--let's rate your breathlessness first.
Maybe a 4 when I'm resting, 6 if I walk upstairs.

ğŸ‘ Nice control. Any dizziness or chest pain?

All set ğŸš—. Driver Miguel arrives 9:15 AM and waits for you. Anything else on your mind?

You breathe, I'll handle the rest ğŸ’™

title: Diabetes Gap Closure
dialog: Hi Florence, my A1C was high last time. What now?
Your last was 7.8%. Let's schedule your three-month follow-up lab.
Quest Maple has Tue 8 AM or Thu 2 PM.
Done. Also, Dr Lee may add Metformin ER. Any questions about side-effects?
ER version reduces that. Take with food; I'll check in 48h.

title: Human Escalation - Chest Pain
dialog: Florence, I'm having chest pain and tightness.
âš ï¸ Escalating now... Connecting you to Nurse Sarah.
Hi, I'm Nurse Sarah. Breathless when resting?
We're calling 911. Ambulance ETA 6 min. Stay seated, chew an aspirin if not allergic. Florence will stay on the line.
Margaret, ambulance confirmed. You're not alone--we've got you â¤ï¸

title: Health-Record Q&A
dialog: Florence, my portal shows 'eGFR = 58 mL/min'--what does that mean?
eGFR measures kidney filtering. 58 is mild stage-3. Many people live decades without issues.
Not panic ğŸ‘Œ. Key is BP control & labs every 6 months. Dr Allen listed Lisinopril--great for kidneys.
Possible light cough or dizziness first week. I'll set a check-in for day 7.
